svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: A template for quickly building login systems on top of Node.js; a fork of
for the allowable options of the verbs.
Millisecond duration for attempting to send emails. Defaults to 5000.
Locale for server log messages; defaults to "en-US".
Database user; only needed with env=production
Database password; only needed with env=production
Current working directory; used with `--config`; defaults to `process.cwd()`
Not normally needed; used to point to instrumented path. Defaults to
Points to a base path for finding locales. Defaults to `app/server`.
Points to a path or URL to which to redirect after users successfully log in.
Defaults to `/home` (or locale equivalent). Note that you are overriding
this option, you should provide another means to your users to visit `/home`,
e.g., through the accessibility-recommended approach of having a site-wide
navigation bar, so as to allow your users to update or delete their accounts.
Note that this option will be overridden by any `redirect` query parameter
A convenience to allow overriding the default route name per locale, e.g.,
for the `en-US` locale. This will take precedence over the routes in
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, passKey, fromText, fromURL). Defaults
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the template
options (_, jml, baseurl, name, user, activationCode, fromText, fromURL).
Whether to require a name from users. Default is `false`.
Point to absolute path at which to serve static files on the same server.
Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving within a particular non-
root path, use `router` with Express'`app.use()`. See
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the resolved
options. Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving within a
particular non-root path, use `router` with Express' `app.use()`. See
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed the Express
Path to a Node file that will be required. The file must have a
`module.exports` default function export that will be passed a config object,
including a `template` string indicating the template being built. Must
return an object with any of 4 optional methods (`headPre`, `headPost`,
`bodyPre`, and/or `bodyPost`) which should return an array of Jamilih
children to be appended at the given position (or return an empty array to
Used to set config; when `cwd` is set, defaults to "<cwd>/nogin.json"; of
lower priority than other CLI arguments; may also be a JavaScript file
Whether to disable logging; defaults to `false` (logging is enabled).
Two-letter country codes as JSON array; defaults to codes in
The database adapter to use. Defaults to "mongodb", the only current option.
The path to a favicon; defaults to blank.
The path to a custom CSS stylesheet; defaults to no extra stylesheets being
Whether to suppress addition of built-in stylesheets, Bootstrap, and gh-fork-
Regular client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none by
ESM client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none by default)
Whether to load framework scripts locally instead of via CDN. Defaults to
Person's name to include as from text in email notifications (password
URL of person to include as link on from text in email notifications
Whether to host coverage within `/coverage`; defaults to `false`.
Whether to show the `/users` page. Off by default for privacy. (May be
removed as an option in the future if privileges are added.)
Used for mitigating DoS attacks; defaults to 100
